article_title: COMMENTARY: Close the dental divide in Texas

og.description: Low-income children and families across Texas — who have been awaiting critical oral healthcare coverage for years now — have recently learned a difficult truth: Having dental coverage doesn’t necessarily mean having access to dental care. This unfortunate fact has emerged since passage of the Affordable Care Act, which expanded Medicaid eligibility to millions and offered dental coverage to 8.3 million Americans who previously had none. Further, similar coverage gains were celebrated in April of this year, when Congress reauthorized funding for the state’s Children’s Health Insurance Plan (CHIP), which gives more than 500,000 Texas children access to early, preventative dental care.
